How can I use the `getmempoolinfo` command to get information about the transaction memory pool?

You can use the `getmempoolinfo` command in two ways:

1. Run `verus getmempoolinfo` in the command line.
2. Use a tool like `curl` to send a JSON-RPC request to the Verus node, with the following format:
```
curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getmempoolinfo", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```
Replace `myusername` with your actual username and `http://127.0.0.1:27486/` with the URL of your Verus node.

getmempoolinfo

Returns details on the active state of the TX memory pool.

Result:
{
 "size": xxxxx        (numeric) Current tx count
 "bytes": xxxxx        (numeric) Sum of all tx sizes
 "usage": xxxxx        (numeric) Total memory usage for the mempool
}

Examples:
> verus getmempoolinfo 
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getmempoolinfo", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
